tool.name: pcdl_plot_scatter
tool.command:
#import re mkdir output_pc && #for $file in $path: #set $filename = re.sub('[^\w\-\.\s]', '_', str($file.element_identifier)) ln -s $file output_pc/$filename && #end for
pcdl_plot_scatter 'output_pc' '$focus' --custom_data_type $custom_data_type --microenv $microenv --physiboss $physiboss --settingxml '$settingxml' --verbose $verbose --z_slice $z_slice --z_axis '$z_axis' --alpha $alpha --cmap '$cmap' --title '$title' --grid $grid --legend_loc '$legend_loc' --xlim '$xlim' --ylim '$ylim' --xyequal $xyequal --s $s --figsizepx '$figsizepx' --directory 'jakku' --ext $ext --figbgcolor '$figbgcolor'

param.name: path
param.label: path
param.help: path to the PhysiCell output data collection

param.name: focus
param.label: focus
param.help: column name from the pcdl_get_cell_attribute_list listing. default is cell_type.

param.name: custom_data_type
param.label: custom_data_type
param.help: parameter to specify custom_data variable types other than float (namely: int, bool, str) like this var:dtype myint:int mybool:bool mystr:str. downstream float and int will be handled as numeric, bool as Boolean, and str as categorical data. default is an empty string.

param.name: microenv
param.label: microenv
param.help: should the microenvironment be extracted and loaded into the df_cell dataframe? setting microenv to False will use less memory and speed up processing, similar to the original pyMCDS_cells.py script. default is True.

param.name: physiboss
param.label: physiboss
param.help: if found, should physiboss state data be extracted and loaded into the df_cell dataframe? default is True.

param.name: settingxml
param.label: settingxml
param.help: the settings.xml that is loaded, from which the cell type ID label mapping, is extracted, if this information is not found in the output xml file. set to None or False if the xml file is missing! default is PhysiCell_settings.xml.

param.name: verbose
param.label: verbose
param.help: setting verbose to True for more text output, while processing. default is False.

param.name: z_slice
param.label: z_slice
param.help: z-axis position to slice a 2D xy-plain out of the 3D mesh. if z_slice position numeric but not an exact mesh center coordinate, then z_slice will be adjusted to the nearest mesh center value, the smaller one, if the coordinate lies on a saddle point. default is 0.0.

param.name: z_axis
param.label: z_axis
param.help: for a categorical focus: list of labels; for a numeric focus: list of two floats; None, depending on the focus column variable dtype, extracts labels or min and max values from data. default is None.

param.name: alpha
param.label: alpha
param.help: alpha channel transparency value between 1 (not transparent at all) and 0 (totally transparent). default is 1.0.

param.name: cmap
param.label: cmap
param.help: matplotlib colormap string from https://matplotlib.org/stable/tutorials/colors/colormaps.html . default is viridis.

param.name: title
param.label: title
param.help: title prefix. default is an empty string.

param.name: grid
param.label: grid
param.help: plot axis grid lines. default is True.

param.name: legend_loc
param.label: legend_loc
param.help: the location of the categorical legend, if applicable. default is 'lower left'

param.name: xlim
param.label: xlim
param.help: two floats separated by a space. x axis min and max value. None takes min and max from mesh x axis range. default is None.

param.name: ylim
param.label: ylim
param.help: two floats separated by a space. y axis min and max value. None takes min and max from mesh y axis range. default is None.

param.name: xyequal
param.label: xyequal
param.help: to specify equal axis spacing for x and y axis. default is true.

param.name: s
param.label: s
param.help: scatter plot dot size scale factor. with figsizepx extracted from initial.svg, scale factor 1.0 should be ok. adjust if necessary. default 1.0.

param.name: figsizepx
param.label: figsizepx
param.help: size of the figure in pixels (integer), x y. the given x and y will be rounded to the nearest even number, to be able to generate movies from the images. None tries to take the values from the initial.svg file. fall back setting is 640 480. default is None.

param.name: ext
param.label: ext
param.help: output image format. possible formats are jpeg, png, and tiff. default is jpeg.

param.name: figbgcolor
param.label: figbgcolor
param.help: figure background color. None is transparent (png) or white (jpeg, tiff). default is None.

tool.help:
function generates pandas scatter plots, under the returned path.
homepage: https://github.com/elmbeech/physicelldataloader
